title: Bug 10403 - Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
EB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted then rebuilt. Some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a new project for an existing directory structure.
2. Point the output folder to a bin directory.
3. Confirm that the bin directory contains files other than .class files.
4. Attempt to delete the output directory and rebuild it.
